rule: The output must never consist of only one word, and it must represent an invalid part-of-speech tag or any unaccepted option other than "Unknown" or "CantAnswer".
input: sentence: The ship sailed smoothly., word: smoothly
validityText:
The input provides a sentence "The ship sailed smoothly." and a word "smoothly". The sentence is a grammatically valid string containing multiple words. It does not contain special characters or symbols not part of normal linguistic usage. The word "smoothly" is a substring of the sentence. It does not include punctuation. Therefore, the input complies with the given input specification.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output consists of a single word, "Unknown". According to the description, "Unknown" is a valid response when the word cannot be tagged with the listed tags. Therefore, the output complies with the chatbot description.
OK
